description: Wild Mushroom Soup with Spinach and Ginger Broth Recipe
headline: Wild Mushroom Soup with Spinach and Ginger Broth
name: Wild Mushroom Soup with Spinach and Ginger Broth
recipeIngredient: 12 ounces fresh shiitake mushrooms, stemmed, caps sliced
12 green onions, white and pale green parts thinly sliced, tops cut into 1/2-inch lengths and reserved
1 5-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled, thinly sliced
1 cup dried porcini mushrooms* (about 3/4 ounce), rinsed briefly

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 3 tablespoons oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add shiitake mushrooms and sauté until golden, about 5 minutes. Transfer mushrooms to medium bowl. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in same pot. Add thinly sliced green onions, ginger, and garlic; sauté 1 minute. Add water, broth, and porcini. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 20 minutes. Strain soup into large pot, pressing on solids in strainer to release as much liquid as possible. Discard solids in strainer. Stir shiitake mushrooms into broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 5 minutes. Add sugar and salt. DO AHEADCan be made 1 day ahead. Cool slightly, cover and refrigerate. Bring to simmer before continuing.
Add green onion tops and spinach to soup and simmer until spinach wilts, about 1 minute. Ladle into bowls.
* Dried porcini mushrooms are available at Italian markets, specialty foods stores and many supermarkets.
